intro: Hieracium bocconei, commonly known as the Boccone's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium bocconei is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments.
